name: Texas A&M Student Section of the Structural Engineers Association of Texas
description:
The Texas A&M University student chapter of the Structural Engineers Association of Texas is committed to bring together students, professionals, and faculty for the common benefit of each.  The chapter aims to facilitate the dissemination of knowledge from experts to the student body and provide a forum for professionals to interact with students and faculty.

All civil engineering students interested in structural engineering are highly encouraged to join SEAoT.  Both undergraduate and graduate students are welcome to join.

Students can enjoy a number of benefits by joining SEAoT which include:

  •  Regular interaction with structural engineering professionals and faculty.
  •  Monthly meetings which include food and seminars from research activities  conducted by experts in academic and professional fields.
  •  Attendance to monthly SEAoT meeting in Houston with the Houston/Gulf Coast  chapter of SEAoT (great place to network).
  •  Opportunity to present your research in a annual symposium.
  •  Attendance to the structural student/faculty picnic.
summary: SEAoT welcomes graduate and undergraduate students who are interested in structural engineering. At monthly meetings students can hear presentations made by other students or by visiting speakers. SEAoT members are also able to attend monthly meetings ...
